algebra.title: Algebra Basics
steps: Let's start with the basics of algebra. Do you know what a variable is?
Great! A variable is a symbol that represents a number. Now let's solve: x + 3 = 7. What is x?
Awesome! x = 4. Here's a resource to go deeper: https://www.khanacademy.org/math/algebra
Now let's try something harder: Solve for y in the equation 2y - 5 = 9.
Correct! y = 7. Keep practicing with this interactive tool: https://example.com/algebra-tool

lesson_3.title: Lesson 3: Photosynthesis
steps: Photosynthesis helps plants make food using sunlight. Do you know what chlorophyll does?
Exactly! It captures sunlight. Now, what gas do plants take in for photosynthesis?

geometry.title: Geometry Basics
steps: Let's explore geometry. Do you know what a triangle is?
Great! A triangle has three sides. Can you name the types of triangles based on their angles?
Correct! Acute, right, and obtuse triangles. Now, calculate the area of a triangle with base 5 and height 10.
Awesome! The area is 25. Here's a geometry practice tool: https://example.com/geometry-tool

lesson_4.title: Lesson 4: The Water Cycle
steps: The water cycle describes how water moves through the environment. Can you name the stages of the water cycle?
Exactly! Evaporation, condensation, precipitation, and collection. What happens during evaporation?
Correct! Water turns into vapor. Here's an animation to learn more: https://example.com/water-cycle-animation
What role does the sun play in the water cycle?
That's right! The sun provides energy for evaporation. Explore this interactive diagram: https://example.com/water-cycle-diagram
